net.fec.openrq.parameters

Class ParameterChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.parameters.ParameterChecker

  • public final class ParameterChecker
extends Object
    This class provides methods for checking bounds and validating FEC and encoding packet parameters.

    FEC parameters bounds

    FEC parameters have well defined bounds, and any parameter that is outside its bounds is considered invalid. It is important to know these bounds in order to be able to create instances of the class FECParameters, which contain only valid values.

    By default, every FEC parameter has a minimum and a maximum value. For example, the method maxNumSourceBlocks() returns the theoretical upper bound on the number of source blocks. However, these minimum and maximum values are not sufficient to limit the possible (valid) parameter values. When multiple parameters are defined, they are also constrained in a way that is conditioned on the combination of the used values. For example, if a very large source data length is defined, then a relatively large symbol size must be defined as well, because there is a limit on the number of symbols into which a source data can be divided.

    Methods are provided for obtaining these conditional bounds. They are summarized below for ease of access.

    Given a source data length it is possible to obtain the minimum allowed symbol size; conversely, given a symbol size it is possible to obtain the maximum allowed source data length. Refer to methods for each:

    • minAllowedSymbolSize(long)
    • maxAllowedDataLength(int)

    Given a source data length and a symbol size, which are valid in respect to each other, it is possible to obtain a minimum and a maximum allowed number of source blocks. Refer to methods for each:

    • minAllowedNumSourceBlocks(long, int)
    • maxAllowedNumSourceBlocks(long, int)

    Given a symbol size, it is possible to obtain a maximum allowed interleaver length. Refer to the method:

    • maxAllowedInterleaverLength(int)

    Deriver parameters bounds

    Parameters that derive FEC parameters, or "deriver parameters", include a source data length, a payload length, and a maximum size for a block decodable in working memory. The payload length parameter is equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter.

    Deriver parameters have well defined bounds, much like the FEC parameters. The source data length has the same bounds as before, as well as the payload length since it is equivalent to the symbol size.

    By default, the maximum decoding block size has a lower bound defined in method minDecodingBlockSize(), but has no upper bound.

    There are also conditional bounds, much like in the FEC parameters. Methods are provided for obtaining these bounds. They are summarized below for ease of access.

    Given a source data length it is possible to obtain the minimum allowed payload length; conversely, given a payload length it is possible to obtain the maximum allowed source data length. Refer to methods for each:

    • minAllowedPayloadLength(long)
    • maxAllowedDataLength(int)

    Given a source data length and a payload length, which are valid in respect to each other, it is possible to obtain a lower bound for the maximum decoding block size. Refer to the method:

    • minAllowedDecodingBlockSize(long, int)

    Given a payload length, within bounds, and a maximum decoding block size, within bounds and no less than the payload length, it is possible to obtain a maximum allowed source data length. Refer to the method:

    • maxAllowedDataLength(int, long)

      • maxAllowedDataLength

        public static long maxAllowedDataLength(int symbSize)
        Returns the maximum allowed data length given a symbol size.

        The provided parameter may also be a payload length, since it is equivalent to the symbol size, therefore the same bounds apply.

        Parameters:
        symbSize - A symbol size, in number of bytes
        Returns:
        the maximum allowed data length given a symbol size
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the symbol size is out of bounds

      • minAllowedNumSourceBlocks

        public static int minAllowedNumSourceBlocks(long dataLen,
                            int symbSize)
        Returns the minimum allowed number of source blocks given a source data length and symbol size.

        Note that besides being within their own bounds, both arguments must also be valid together, that is, either the source data length must be upper bounded given the symbol size, or the symbol size must be lower bounded given the source data length.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        symbSize - A symbol size, in number of bytes
        Returns:
        the minimum allowed number of source blocks given a source data length and symbol size
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If either argument is individually out of bounds, or if they are out of bounds in unison

      • areValidFECParameters

        public static boolean areValidFECParameters(long dataLen,
                            int symbSize,
                            int numSrcBs,
                            int interLen)
        Returns true if, and only if, the provided FEC parameters are valid, that is, if they fall within certain bounds.

        This method shouldn't be called directly. It is mainly used to test the validity of parameters when creating FECParameters instances. If this method returns false then an exception is thrown by the creator method.

        It is possible, a priori, to obtain lower and upper bounds for valid parameter values. If the parameters fall within these bounds, then this method always returns true. For information on how to obtain these bounds, refer to the section on "FEC parameter bounds" in the class header.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        symbSize - A symbol size, in number of bytes
        numSrcBs - A number of source blocks into which a source data is divided
        interLen - An interleaver length, in number of sub-blocks per source block
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the provided FEC parameters are within certain bounds

      • getFECParamsErrorString

        public static String getFECParamsErrorString(long dataLen,
                             int symbSize,
                             int numSrcBs,
                             int interLen)
        Tests if the FEC parameters are valid according to areValidFECParameters(long, int, int, int), and if so the method returns an empty string, otherwise it returns an error string indicating which parameters are invalid.
        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        symbSize - A symbol size, in number of bytes
        numSrcBs - A number of source blocks into which a source data is divided
        interLen - An interleaver length, in number of sub-blocks per source block
        Returns:
        an error string if some parameter is invalid or an empty string if all parameters are valid

      • minPayloadLength

        public static int minPayloadLength()
        Returns the minimum payload length, in number of bytes. This value is equivalent to the minimum symbol size.
        Returns:
        the minimum payload length, in number of bytes

      • maxPayloadLength

        public static int maxPayloadLength()
        Returns the maximum payload length, in number of bytes. This value is equivalent to the maximum symbol size.
        Returns:
        the maximum payload length, in number of bytes

      • isPayloadLengthOutOfBounds

        public static boolean isPayloadLengthOutOfBounds(int payLen)
        Returns false iff minPayLen ≤ payLen ≤ maxPayLen.
        Parameters:
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        Returns:
        false iff minPayLen ≤ payLen ≤ maxPayLen

      • minAllowedPayloadLength

        public static int minAllowedPayloadLength(long dataLen)
        Returns the minimum allowed payload length given a source data length. This method is equivalent to method minAllowedSymbolSize(long).
        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        Returns:
        the minimum allowed payload length given a source data length.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the source data length is out of bounds

      • minDecodingBlockSize

        public static long minDecodingBlockSize()
        Returns the lowest possible bound on the maximum size for a block decodable in working memory.
        Returns:
        the lowest possible bound on the maximum size for a block decodable in working memory

      • minAllowedDecodingBlockSize

        public static long minAllowedDecodingBlockSize(long dataLen,
                               int payLen)
        Returns a lower bound on the maximum size for a block decodable in working memory, given a source data length and payload length.

        Note that besides being within their own bounds, both arguments must also be valid together, that is, either the source data length must be upper bounded given the payload length, or the payload length must be lower bounded given the source data length .

        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        Returns:
        a lower bound on the maximum size for a block decodable in working memory
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If either argument is individually out of bounds, or if they are out of bounds in unison

      • maxAllowedDataLength

        public static long maxAllowedDataLength(int payLen,
                        long maxDBMem)
        Returns the maximum allowed data length given a payload length and a maximum size for a block decodable in working memory.

        Bounds checking - The following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • isPayloadLengthOutOfBounds(payLen) == false
        • maxDBMem >= minDecodingBlockSize()
        • maxDBMem >= payLen
        Parameters:
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        maxDBMem - A maximum size, in number of bytes, for a block decodable in working memory
        Returns:
        the maximum allowed data length given a payload length and a maximum size for a block decodable in working memory
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is out of bounds (see method description)

      • areValidDeriverParameters

        public static boolean areValidDeriverParameters(long dataLen,
                                int payLen,
                                long maxDBMem)
        Returns true if, and only if, the provided deriver parameters are valid, that is, if they fall within certain bounds.

        This method shouldn't be called directly. It is mainly used to test the validity of parameters when deriving FECParameters instances. If this method returns false then an exception is thrown by the deriver method.

        It is possible, a priori, to obtain lower and upper bounds for valid parameter values. If the parameters fall within these bounds, then this method always returns true. For information on how to obtain these bounds, refer to the section on "Deriver parameter bounds" in the class header.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        maxDBMem - A maximum size, in number of bytes, for a block decodable in working memory
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the provided deriver parameters are within certain bounds

      • getDeriverParamsErrorString

        public static String getDeriverParamsErrorString(long dataLen,
                                 int payLen,
                                 long maxDBMem)
        Tests if the deriver parameters are valid according to areValidDeriverParameters(long, int, long), and if so the method returns an empty string, otherwise it returns an error string indicating which parameters are invalid.
        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        maxDBMem - A maximum size, in number of bytes, for a block decodable in working memory
        Returns:
        an error string if some parameter is invalid or an empty string if all parameters are valid

      • isValidFECPayloadID

        public static boolean isValidFECPayloadID(int sbn,
                          int esi,
                          int numSrcBs)
        Returns true if, and only if, the FEC payload ID parameters are valid, that is, if they fall within certain bounds.

        The source block number (SBN) must be greater than or equal to its minimum value, given by the method minSourceBlockNumber(). The SBN must also be less than the number of source blocks.

        The encoding symbol identifier (ESI) must not be out of bounds, meaning that the following method should return false when passing the ESI as parameter: isEncodingSymbolIDOutOfBounds(int).

        Parameters:
        sbn - A source block number
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in an encoding packet
        numSrcBs - A number of source blocks into which a source data is divided
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the provided FEC payload ID parameters are within certain bounds
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the number of source blocks is out of bounds

      • getFECPayloadIDErrorString

        public static String getFECPayloadIDErrorString(int sbn,
                                int esi,
                                int numSBs)
        Tests if the FEC Payload ID parameters are valid according to isValidFECPayloadID(int, int, int), and if so the method returns an empty string, otherwise it returns an error string indicating which parameters are invalid.
        Parameters:
        sbn - A source block number
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in an encoding packet
        numSBs - A number of source blocks into which a source data is divided
        Returns:
        an error string if some parameter is invalid or an empty string if all parameters are valid
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the number of source blocks is out of bounds

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static int numRepairSymbolsPerBlock(int numSrcSymbs)
        Returns the total number of possible repair symbols in a source block, given the number of source symbols in the block.
